thread.title: BRAD'S BELIEFS: Should the Royals fear the beard that is Dallas
thread.title_full: BRAD'S BELIEFS: Should the Royals fear the beard that is Dallas - KCTV5

author: Posted by Laura McCallister, Multimedia Producer
title: BRAD'S BELIEFS: Should the Royals fear the beard that is Dallas
text:
HOUSTON, TX (KCTV) - Baseball may be the craziest game of all. 
A butt-out, emergency hack by Kansas City Royals first baseman Eric Hosmer may have gotten the baseball Gods back on the side of the Royals.  His blooper/doinker/flare of a single in the 6th inning arched over the shortstop’s head and landed in shallow left field. It looked more like a women’s fast pitch softball swing.
But it worked. It scored Lorenzo Cain and helped lead the Royals to a dramatic, come from behind, 5-4 win over the Houston Astros on Friday. The best-of-five American League Division Series is now tied 1-1 and headed to Texas.  Playoff games and series can hinge on weird plays just like that one.
So now what?
It’s on to face a guy named Dallas in the city of Houston. Wait, what?  Yeah.  Dallas (Keuchel) in Houston.  It’s the way they roll in the Lone Star State.  They name their kids after towns. I’ve never met anyone in Kansas named Topeka. Or Buhler. Or Gardner-Edgerton. But it’s Texas and people in Texas love them some Texas. 
The Royals will face Houston Astros ace pitcher Dallas Kuechel. He’s 15-0 at Minute Maid Park this year. He was the starting pitcher for Ned Yost’s American League All-Star Team and he’ll probably win the Cy Young Award.
And he’s got a huge beard. Everything’s bigger in Texas. (Except for the Astros' ballpark that has a short porch in left field.)
When the Astros made their one and only visit to Kauffman Stadium this year they won the first game of the series and extended their winning streak over the Royals to seven games. The Royals snapped the losing streak to the Astros when they won the second game of the three-game series. 
I remember Yost talking after the game about how relieved he was to get that win considering Dallas was pitching for Houston in the final game of the series. 
But a funny thing happened to the best pitcher in the league that Sunday afternoon. The Royals roped him, knocked him out of the game, early.  The Royals ended up winning the game and the series against the Astros.
My point behind this is that anything can happen. Weird things. Unexplainable things. Especially in baseball and even more so in the playoffs. 
The propeller-headed analytics community will tell you the Royals have no chance to beat Dallas in Houston and win game 3 of the ALDS.
Tell that to the baseball Gods.
Even tell them the Royals were swept in Houston this year.
The math guys care. The baseballs Gods don’t.
First pitch is 3:10 p.m. Sunday in Houston. Not Dallas.
